google-analytics.label: Google Analytics

_gac_.description: Contains information related to marketing campaigns of the user. These are shared with Google AdWords / Google Ads when the Google Ads and Google Analytics accounts are linked together.

__utma.description: ID used to identify users and sessions

__utmt.description: Used to monitor number of Google Analytics server requests

__utmb.description: Used to distinguish new sessions and visits. This cookie is set when the GA.js javascript library is loaded and there is no existing __utmb cookie. The cookie is updated every time data is sent to the Google Analytics server.

__utmc.description: Used only with old Urchin versions of Google Analytics and not with GA.js. Was used to distinguish between new sessions and visits at the end of a session.

__utmz.description: Contains information about the traffic source or campaign that directed user to the website. The cookie is set when the GA.js javascript is loaded and updated when data is sent to the Google Anaytics server

__utmv.description: Contains custom information set by the web developer via the _setCustomVar method in Google Analytics. This cookie is updated every time new data is sent to the Google Analytics server.

__utmx.description: Used to determine whether a user is included in an A / B or Multivariate test.

_gali.description: Used by Google Analytics to determine which links on a page are being clicked

_gid.description: ID used to identify users for 24 hours after last activity

_gat.description: Used to monitor number of Google Analytics server requests when using Google Tag Manager

google-analytics.description: Google Analytics is a powerful tool that tracks and analyzes website traffic for informed marketing decisions.

clarity.label: Microsoft Clarity

ANONCHK.description: Indicates whether MUID is transferred to ANID, a cookie used for advertising. Clarity doesn't use ANID and so this is always set to 0.

CLID.description: Identifies the first-time Clarity saw this user on any site using Clarity.

_clsk.description: Connects multiple page views by a user into a single Clarity session recording.

_clck.description: Persists the Clarity User ID and preferences, unique to that site is attributed to the same user ID.

clarity.description: Clarity is a web analytics service that tracks and reports website traffic.
